cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 325 miles E of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving WSW, forecast to turn WNW on Wednesday and then NW/N across Florida toward southern Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east coast of Florida between Boca Raton and the Flagler/Volusia County Line

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Hallandale Beach to north of Ocean Reef Florida (includes Miami-Dade coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Boca Raton to Flagler/Volusia County Line; Tropical Storm Warning: Hallandale Beach to Boca Raton and Flagler/Volusia County Line to Altamaha Sound GA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast and east-central Florida coastline, especially Palm Beach through Volusia counties; broader impacts northward into Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Yes — forecast 3–5 inches with local 8 inches possible
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No — 1–2 ft expected along Biscayne Bay and Miami coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph, gusts to 55 mph) possible Wednesday night into Thursday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible along Biscayne Bay and low-lying Miami waterfront at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Wednesday–Thursday could total 3–5 inches and trigger localized urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents and isolated tornado risk beginning late Wednesday
